title: U.S. Will Pay $88 Million to Families and Survivors of 2015 Shooting at Black Church
sub_head: Settlement follows FBI’s admission that it botched a background check that should have kept shooter Dylann Roof from possessing a gun
body:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. government will pay a total of $88 million to families of those killed in the 2015 shooting at a Black church in South Carolina and to survivors, settling lawsuits over a botched FBI background check that allowed the gunman to buy his weapon, the Justice Department said Thursday.
The families of the nine victims will receive between $6 million and $7.5 million each, and the five people wounded in the shooting will get $5 million each, the agency said.
